case_circumstances: The victim was found around 14.45, April 22, 1999, floating in Cedar Creek. Three men walking near Metea County Park discovered his body at Hursh Road and Cedar Creek. His hands were bound and he had been stabbed repeatedly.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: A tan shirt with vertical blue and red stripes that was made in Paris. Brown, button-fly "Levis" with a red tint; an extra-large, navy blue, hooded sweat shirt; black underwear with a puppy or teddy bear design, and white socks.
case_footwear: size 8 wide, brown "Timberland" Gortex, low cut boots
case_jewelry: A cross necklace with black and brown leather rope
dental: Dental information / charting is currently not available
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
